extendedIngredients.name: almond milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup Blue Diamond Unsweetened Almond Milk

extendedIngredients.name: cherries
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 heaping cups cherries, halved and pitted

extendedIngredients.name: flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups King Arthur White Whole Wheat Flour

extendedIngredients.name: light brown sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup packed light brown sugar

recipes.title: Cherry Pie Muffins
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Oil a muffin tin, including the top.Make the oat topping. In a small bowl combine sugar, flour, oats, and cinnamon. Stir until incorporated. Drizzle in oil and stir until small clumps have formed.In a medium bowl, stir together flour, cinnamon, and ginger to combine. In a large bowl, stir together milk, sugars, oil, eggs, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix until the mixture is fully combined.Pour the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in the cherries.Using a regular sized ice cream scoop, scoop batter into each muffin cup, filling to the top. Distribute extra batter evenly among the cups. Sprinkle oat topping evenly over each muffin, pushing it slightly into the batter so it sticks.Bake for 5 mintues. Then immediately reduce the oven temperature to 375 degrees F and bake for about 15-18 minutes more, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out with just a few moist crumbs on it.Cool completely in pan. To remove from pan, loosen tops of muffins from pan with fingers before pushing a rubber spatula gently down the side of each cup to slowly force the muffin out of the cup. May be stored at room temperature for up to 3 days, or frozen, wrapped in parchment and foil and placed in a zipper bag for up to 4 months. Thaw in a 350 degree F oven for about 25 minutes or at room temperature for several hours.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Oil a muffin tin, including the top.Make the oat topping. In a small bowl combine sugar, flour, oats, and cinnamon. Stir until incorporated.

Drizzle in oil and stir until small clumps have formed.In a medium bowl, stir together flour, cinnamon, and ginger to combine. In a large bowl, stir together milk, sugars, oil, eggs, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Mix until the mixture is fully combined.

Pour the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in the cherries.Using a regular sized ice cream scoop, scoop batter into each muffin cup, filling to the top. Distribute extra batter evenly among the cups. Sprinkle oat topping evenly over each muffin, pushing it slightly into the batter so it sticks.

Bake for 5 mintues. Then immediately reduce the oven temperature to 375 degrees F and bake for about 15-18 minutes more, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out with just a few moist crumbs on it.Cool completely in pan. To remove from pan, loosen tops of muffins from pan with fingers before pushing a rubber spatula gently down the side of each cup to slowly force the muffin out of the cup. May be stored at room temperature for up to 3 days, or frozen, wrapped in parchment and foil and placed in a zipper bag for up to 4 months. Thaw in a 350 degree F oven for about 25 minutes or at room temperature for several hours.
